utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: So what do you think? This feels different, doesn’t it?

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: What does?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Rolling up to a crime scene as a married couple. We’re like Nick and Nora Charles.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ooh, like McMillan and Wife.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hart to Hart.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Turner and Hooch.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Turner and Hooch aren’t even married.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but you still remind me a little of Hooch.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So … morning blend? Did this just happen?

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. A jogger found him about an hour ago.

utterance.speaker: LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: Which is about the time he died. Needless to say, it’s pretty obvious what killed him. Gunshot wound to the head.

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Him being Paul Reeves out of Queens. We’re running down next of kin.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Anyone hear the shot?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No. And there’s no video coverage in this area of the park.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Killer probably knew that. He took Reeves' phone, cash from his wallet, and probably waltzed right out of here. It looks like a mugging gone wrong.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, there’s no signs of struggle. If this was a mugging and he didn’t put up a fight, why risk shooting him? Especially in broad daylight?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Singed fabric. Nobody heard anything because the killer used a backpack or a cloth to muffle the shot.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And then took the victim’s phone and cash to throw us off track.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This wasn’t a mugging. This was deliberate murder.

utterance.speaker: BRENT REEVES
utterance.content: That just doesn’t make sense. Paul didn’t have an enemy in the world.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, how much do you know about your brother’s life? Were you close?

utterance.speaker: BRENT
utterance.content: Very close. In fact, Paul had been staying at my place for the past month. He was waiting to close escrow on a condo.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Was having a coffee in the park something he did often?

utterance.speaker: BRENT
utterance.content: He never went to the park. He hardly ever left the office. Paul was a complete workaholic.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what did he do, exactly?

utterance.speaker: BRENT
utterance.content: He was an investigator for the government. The GAO. I don’t know much more than that. He really couldn’t discuss his job.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Was he having any troubles at work that you’re aware of?

utterance.speaker: BRENT
utterance.content: Not trouble, exactly, but … last night we had a beer. Paul said how a crucial meeting had come up that he was worried about.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What kind of meeting? I mean, with whom?

utterance.speaker: BRENT
utterance.content: He didn’t say, but he had gotten a disturbing call from someone involved in one of his cases. I mean, he said … - that meeting. I think that was supposed to happen this morning.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What exactly did Paul investigate?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Like defense contractors billing five hundred bucks for a hammer.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So if someone was fleecing Uncle Sam he could cancel their contracts?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Did anyone ever pressure Paul to back off a report or investigation?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Be that as it may, we need the files of all his active investigations.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Paul Reeves had over twenty open cases and he was taking on some major players. A hospital chain that defrauded Medicare, a lab at Latham Pharmaceuticals cited for lax storage practices, and a company that sold the VA defective medical equipment.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I feel the heavy hand of conspiracy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, well, what else is new?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Consider this: Paul uncovers a nefarious scandal, rife with corruption and financial skullduggery in connection with a federal contract. But with millions of dollars at stake, the greedy contractor, determined to stay latched on to the federal teat, lures Paul into a meeting in the park where he has an assassin silence him, thus Paul’s findings never come to light.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And I don’t suppose that you have a particular case of Paul’s in mind, do you? Or proof? Or suspects?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. But I will once you identify who met Paul at the park.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I might be a step closer to that. Do you remember how Paul’s brother mentioned that a meeting had just come up? Well, I looked into Paul’s phone calls for the last forty-eight hours. One of them stood out. An incoming call to his office at 11:04 yesterday morning. The call lasted less than a minute and I traced it to a payphone on the lower East side.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Try and find out who made that call.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: TORY ELLIS
utterance.content: This is street cam video of that payphone, 11:04 yesterday morning. This is the man who called Paul Reeves.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Tory ran the image and got a match on his face.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Jared Stone, misdemeanor computer trespassing?

utterance.speaker: TORY
utterance.content: Otherwise known as hacking.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Stone was an Occupy Wall Street activist who hacked into a major bank, releasing their emails, which reflected poorly on their business practices.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So why would a hacker like Jared Stone kill a GAO investigator?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He wouldn’t. That story doesn’t make any sense. But this one does: using his vaunted hacking skills, Jared Stone is the one who uncovered the nefarious scandal.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So we’re back to a nefarious scandal.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes. See, he wants to blow the lid off of a scandal, so who better to call than intrepid investigator Paul Reeves. Because, wait for it … Jared Stone is a whistleblower. And Paul Reeves was murdered because of what Jared Stone told him. Which … which actually means he could be in danger now.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You have to admit, Castle’s theory is surprisingly logical.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes. And it’s conveniently unburdened by evidence. Nevertheless, let’s bring Jared Stone in for questioning and let’s take a look at that footage of the payphone for the past two weeks. If Jared Stone talked to anyone, I want to know who it was.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. I may have an address on Jared Stone. I ran his emails. He rented a place on the lower West off Craigslist.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Go.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So what’s going on with married life, huh? How is that? The whole family thing?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Sarah Grace. She’s – she’s growing up, changing so fast. I’m just trying to hold on to every second.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What kind of dad do you think I’d be?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You’d be great.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, even growing up with no role model?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, you know, the thing of it is, is you know what it’s like not having a father. You’d make sure your kid never felt that way. You and Lanie, huh?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No. She likes things how they are. But you know. Maybe I’m ready for more than that. You know what I’m saying? Move forward.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Did you hear that? That sound?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No. What’s that?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That’s my biological clock ticking. Tick, tock. Tick, tock.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We were having a genuine, honest moment here. And you had to ruin it by being a jackass.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hold on. Slow down, slow down.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That’s Jared Stone.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hang tight here. I’ll follow him on foot, make sure we don’t lose him.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey, bro. Yeah, followed him down into the subway. I’m looking for him now.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What, you lost him?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No, I didn’t lose him. I just … don’t have visual contact.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That’s kind of splitting hairs, isn’t it? Look, I’ll head down there and I’ll –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No, you stay there. I’ll – wait, I see him. He’s at my 12. He’s moving fast. He’s scared, like someone’s after him.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: If someone is, you better get to him before they do. Whoever killed Reeves may be gunning for Stone.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He’s boarding the 7th Ave express.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: All right, I’m on the train with Stone.

utterance.speaker: OFFICER MARISA ARAGON
utterance.content: You’re holding an uncapped marker and you’re telling me you were not about to tag this subway car?

utterance.speaker: DUSTIN
utterance.content: Yes. I mean, no.

utterance.speaker: ARAGON
utterance.content: I’m need to see some identification. I’m going to have to write you up for this.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Jared Stone? Hey. You’re not in trouble, bro, but – – look, I’m just here to talk to you.

utterance.speaker: JARED
utterance.content: Put your gun on the ground. Now!

utterance.speaker: JARED
utterance.content: Put your gun on the ground, now. Do it!

utterance.speaker: JARED
utterance.content: Kick it over to me.

utterance.speaker: JARED
utterance.content: Step back. Nobody else move.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Nobody’s moving, man. I just came here to talk to you. I’m on your side.

utterance.speaker: JARED
utterance.content: No, you’re a blunt instrument. A tool of the one percent.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Look, nobody’s hurt yet. It’s just a big misunderstanding. So why don’t you lower that weapon and we can walk right out of here?

utterance.speaker: JARED
utterance.content: Oh, is that really possible?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It is. Yeah. You just have to put the gun down, Jared.

utterance.speaker: JARED
utterance.content: What the hell is that? Are you on the phone?

utterance.speaker: JARED
utterance.content: Everybody shut off your phones and get on the ground, now!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Javi? Javi!

utterance.speaker: JARED
utterance.content: Stay down, don’t move, and nobody gets hurt.

utterance.speaker: BELLA
utterance.content: This cannot be happening.

utterance.speaker: TY
utterance.content: Please. Look, don’t do this. Okay? Don’t hurt my wife.

utterance.speaker: GRANT GERBER
utterance.content: Or the rest of us. Let’s be inclusive.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey. Everybody just stay calm. All right? We’re all going to be fine.

utterance.speaker: JARED
utterance.content: You’re not in charge. I am. I pulled the emergency brake. Why hasn’t the conductor come over the intercom yet?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I don’t know, maybe he –

utterance.speaker: JARED
utterance.content: Shh! You feel that? That’s movement. Like people are getting off the train. Evacuating. How do they know? Who were you on the phone with?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Just a friend, man.

utterance.speaker: JARED
utterance.content: What kind of friend? Is it another cop? Was it a cop? Huh? I can hit redial if I want.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, he was – he was NYPD, but that doesn’t mean anything.

utterance.speaker: JARED
utterance.content: Shut up! Look, everybody just stop talking, okay? I’ve gotta think.

utterance.speaker: ARAGON
utterance.content: He took my service weapon? How did I let him do that?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey, it could happen to anybody. Okay? I’m Javier. Javier Esposito.

utterance.speaker: ARAGON
utterance.content: Marisa Aragon.

utterance.speaker: GERBER
utterance.content: Jared. May I call you Jared? Grant Gerber, salesman by trade. Which means I’m a listener. I listen, learn what people want so I can give it to them. Let me do that for you, Jared. I want to help you get what you want.

utterance.speaker: JARED
utterance.content: I think you’ll get your chance.

utterance.speaker: CAPTAIN VICTORIA GATES
utterance.content: I’ve just been informed that Jared Stone, a person of interest in the Paul Reeves case, drew a gun on a subway and took hostages, including Detective Esposito. At this point, it’s not clear why Jared Stone …

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, if anybody can handle it, Espo can. Why would Stone take hostages?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Right now, our sole priority is to gather any and all information on Jared Stone so the hostage rescue team will know who we’re dealing with. All intel comes to me so I can forward it directly to HRT. They should be on the scene right now.

utterance.speaker: CAPTAIN BIGALOW
utterance.content: Detective Ryan.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yes, sir.

utterance.speaker: BIGALOW
utterance.content: Captain Bigalow, HRT. What’s the intel on your suspect?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Sir, he’s a hacker and Occupy Wall Street activist. It’s all sketchy.

utterance.speaker: BIGALOW
utterance.content: What about your boy Esposito? Is he someone we can count on? He’s solid?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: He’s as solid as they get.

utterance.speaker: BIGALOW
utterance.content: Roger that.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, Beckett. I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Kevin, no one could have seen this coming.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No, no. He’s my partner. I should have never let him go in there alone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’ve gotta focus on getting Javi out of there. So once you brief HRT just head over to Stone’s apartment.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Leave the scene?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, there’s nothing that you can do that HRT isn’t already doing. And if we want to help Javi out, then the best thing that we can do is find out who Jared Stone is and why he is doing this. And some of those answers might be at his apartment.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Okay. I’ll check it out and let you know.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Kate! Is it true? What they’re saying?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Listen, he has been in worse scrapes than this and we are going to get him out of there, I promise you.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Detective Beckett? Doctor Parish? We’ve got eyes on Esposito.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where’s this coming from? I didn’t think the MTA had cameras in the subway cars.

utterance.speaker: TORY
utterance.content: They don’t. The train is part of a pilot program for video security. This is on a separate feed so it took me a while to find it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait, if this is on a separate feed –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That means that we can see Stone but he doesn’t know that.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Which gives us a tactical edge. I’ll make sure HRT knows about this.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: At least Javi’s not down there alone. There’s another cop with him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, between the two of them they might be able to defuse the situation.

utterance.speaker: ARAGON
utterance.content: Kind of a weird time for him to be hitting his playlist.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He’s trying to calm himself down.

utterance.speaker: ARAGON
utterance.content: Because he’s about to do what?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I might need you to back me up. Can you do that?

utterance.speaker: ARAGON
utterance.content: What’s your play?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Talk to him. Try to get him see the light, then disarm him if I get the chance.

utterance.speaker: ARAGON
utterance.content: I should talk to him. I’m the one wearing the Kevlar.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, but I’ve already got a rapport with the guy, so…

utterance.speaker: ARAGON
utterance.content: A bad rapport. I know what this is. I’m just a transit cop. You gold shield guys always acting like you’re better than us.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We are better than you.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Mr. Stone! Permission to speak?

utterance.speaker: JARED
utterance.content: Go ahead.

utterance.speaker: JARED
utterance.content: That’s far enough.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Look, whatever went down between you and Paul Reeves, this is only going to make it worse.

utterance.speaker: JARED
utterance.content: This wasn’t supposed to happen. Not here. This wasn’t part of the plan.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Then we can come up with a new plan. One where you walk out of here. You can still do that.

utterance.speaker: JARED
utterance.content: It’s too late. Police are already involved. Now there’s no turning back.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You have to turn back, Jared. Because if you don’t, here’s what’s going to happen. HRT, that’s the hostage rescue team, will wait for you to get weak and tired. And a dozen highly trained guys, armed to the teeth, will breach this car. And trust me when I tell you, they will not play. You’ll be lucky to get off one shot before they drop you.

utterance.speaker: JARED
utterance.content: HRT won’t come near me. Not once they know I have this.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Oh my God. A suicide vest?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: His left hand. That’s a dead man’s switch. He lets go of that …

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Clearly Jared Stone is not a whistle blower.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He’s a terrorist wearing an explosive vest. This was a planned attack.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: I’ll contact Homeland, see what they have on him. Keep working intel on Jared Stone. Obviously this man is not at all who we thought he was.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Jared, what are you doing, man?

utterance.speaker: JARED
utterance.content: It’s kind of self-explanatory, isn’t it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Look, I know you’re an activist and you’re all about taking on the one percent, but do you see anybody like that here?

utterance.speaker: GERBER
utterance.content: Look, I may be a salesman, but just so you know, I am not a big earner. Okay? I am barely scraping by.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Jared. They are working people. Your people. You don’t want to hurt them.

utterance.speaker: JARED
utterance.content: You’re right. I don’t. But I will. If I have to.

utterance.speaker: JARED
utterance.content: Take a picture. Text it to HRT.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I need you to tell me everything you know about Jared Stone.

utterance.speaker: LANDLORD
utterance.content: Just that he wanted the apartment for two weeks, so I rented it to him.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Did you meet the guy? Talk to him?

utterance.speaker: LANDLORD
utterance.content: Just when I gave him the key. And told him that I did not permit wild parties.

utterance.speaker: LANDLORD
utterance.content: What’s this about?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Comb through every inch of this place. Look through all this papers, personal items. Anything that can tell us who Jared Stone is or what he’s up to.

utterance.speaker: LANDLORD
utterance.content: Excuse me, gentlemen. But could I ask you to remove your shoes? The carpet is brand new.

utterance.speaker: LANDLORD
utterance.content: Just a thought.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Homeland doesn’t have a file on Jared Stone. Neither does NYPD Counterterrorism.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why would Stone blow up the subway? I’ve been reading his posts on income inequality. He’s a little pedantic, but he’s an armchair revolutionary. He’s not a man of action.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Maybe he became radicalized somehow.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The Taking of Pelham 1, 2, 3 could not have been his plan. He must have been heading someplace else when Esposito stopped him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He was. Stone was set to attend a wealth management seminar with fifteen hundred people at the Tremaine Hotel. That’s where he was going when Esposito came along.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: The 7th Avenue express would have taken him right there. And if he was after one percenters this seminar would be a target rich environment.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sir, he also had a backup target. He had seats to an opera at the biggest theater on Broadway. Nineteen hundred seats.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: He was going for maximum casualties. And he’s willing to kill himself in the process. I’ll pass this on to HRT. Oh. One more thing. Tory ran video on that payphone. Stone did use it before. He called the Maldives last week. Twice.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The Maldives?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who was he talking to?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: The cell phone he has is no longer active. We can’t track it down. Oh. Gates. HRT is asking what kind of pizza does Esposito like?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh .. pineapple, olives, and double jalapeños, sir.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: I’ll pass it along. Uh, pineapple …

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Since when does a hacker, who, by his very nature, tends to live his life virtually, morph into a suicide bomber? Stone has no history of violence.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You think something happened to trigger him?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t know, but there’s a piece missing here somewhere. How does a GAO investigator fit into this? The calls to the Maldives? Has Ryan turned anything up?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. So far no word.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Excuse me. This receipt from two days ago for the shredder. Did you buy it?

utterance.speaker: LANDLORD
utterance.content: No. I don’t even know where that came from. It really doesn’t fit.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Then Stone bought it. Excuse me.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: He’s shredding documents. Okay. We need to bag this up and take it back to the precinct, put it back together. Find out what Stone was trying to hide.

utterance.speaker: JARED
utterance.content: So how’d you find me? How’d you track me down?

utterance.speaker: JARED
utterance.content: Do you know about White Knight?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What’s White Knight?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That’ll be the negotiator. You want something, right? Now’ll be the time to ask for it.

utterance.speaker: JARED
utterance.content: Hello? Yes, it is. Hello, Bob. You’re the negotiator? I’m fine. Yeah, yeah. They’re all fine too. Uh, let me ask. Is anybody hungry?

utterance.speaker: BELLA
utterance.content: I’m always hungry.

utterance.speaker: GERBER
utterance.content: So am I.

utterance.speaker: JARED
utterance.content: Yeah, um … everybody could use some food right about now. Um – – well you do that, Bob. My demands? Do I have demands? Yeah. I got one. You listening? I want Erin Wilson released from prison. You call me back when you have a plan to make that happen.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s all he said?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who the hell is Aaron Wilson?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Well, if we want to save these people we need to find out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, let’s find who this Aaron Wilson is.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait a minute. Castle, it’s a woman. E, R, I, N. She’s serving seven years in federal prison for felony computer trespassing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So she’s a hacker, too?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Court records show that she hacked a database at the New York Federal Reserve looking for proof that the Fed colluded with big banks.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What’s her connection to Stone?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It looks like Jared Stone was an accomplice. But the US Attorney didn’t have enough to charge him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So they were partners in crime. Erin went to prison, Stone didn’t. That’s why he wants to get her out. He feels guilty. That would also explain the Maldives.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s a non-extradition country.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey guys. You need to see this.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What was in that shredder was about two pages of text. So far we’ve been able to assemble a few random words like “monitor” and “surveillance”.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, what do you think it is?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It’s some kind of letter. But I don’t think that Stone was the one who wrote it. Take a look at this phrase that we assembled just now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: “Read, memorize, then destroy.”

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It’s not like he would write that to himself.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So they’re instructions. Now we know Stone was working with other people. Maybe this is all about Erin Wilson. Maybe she’s the one behind all of this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle and I will look into Erin Wilson and we’ll dig deeper. We’ll also see if we can identify any associates that Jared might have had.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We’ll keep piecing this together here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Guys, everyone down there is counting on us.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey. Who’s Erin Wilson?

utterance.speaker: JARED
utterance.content: She’s my soul mate.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, why didn’t you give Bob more to go on so he knew who you were talking about?

utterance.speaker: JARED
utterance.content: I want to keep him off balance. Maintain control.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You get that tip off the internet? ‘Cause it’s not a very good one.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What’s White Knight?

utterance.speaker: JARED
utterance.content: Tell me your plan for Erin. What the hell is taking so long, Bob? Getting her in prison didn’t seem to take any time at all. Bob, shut up. Shut up! Listen to me. I want her flown to the Maldives. Yeah, well, I’m telling you now, Bob. Okay? I want her flown to the Maldives and in a half an hour I want your plan on how to make that happen, are we clear? Yeah, Bob. Food would be great right about now. No, don’t send any cops. I don’t care if they’re unarmed, Bob. I don’t want any police near this car. Just drop the food. Then set it on the edge of the platform! I’ll send somebody to get it.

utterance.speaker: JARED
utterance.content: You. The husband. Go. Get the food. I know you’ll come back.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Just got bad news. Called the prison. Spoke to Erin Wilson.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She’s Stone’s girlfriend. She didn’t seem to know about his plan to break her out until just now. What about you? Anything on Stone’s known associates?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Stone may have lived online, but he wasn’t very social. He started a “Free Erin Wilson” website but didn’t seem to interact with any of the users.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He had to have interacted with somebody. Tech scrubbed his computer and found a hidden directory that they think contained private correspondence.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: From whom?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Contents were thoroughly erased. The only thing left was the name of the directory. White Knight.

utterance.speaker: TY
utterance.content: Okay, who’s next? We’ve got double cheese, pepperoni, mushroom.

utterance.speaker: ARAGON
utterance.content: Uh, right here. Thanks.

utterance.speaker: ARAGON
utterance.content: You doing okay?

utterance.speaker: TY
utterance.content: Veggie with eggplant and garlic. Pineapple, olives, double jalapeño.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That’s for me.

utterance.speaker: ARAGON
utterance.content: Really? We’re trapped in a subway car. I’m not sure you should eat that.

utterance.speaker: ARAGON
utterance.content: You going to eat that thing or just gaze at it in wonder?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t understand. Why does HRT want to breach?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: In their assessment, Stone is trapped with no good options and no way to carry out his original plan. They believe the longer this goes the more likely he will do the unthinkable.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Why not see how things play out with Erin Wilson?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: HRT thinks the Erin Wilson demand is a ruse. Stone is playing this card to buy time, work up his nerve.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: If they bust in, what’ll keep Stone from blowing that vest?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Esposito will. He’s in on it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Won’t Stone see HRT coming?

utterance.speaker: TORY
utterance.content: Yes, if they approach via the tunnel. But they’re dropping onto the train from above, through the subway grates.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: When?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Soon. Any moment now.

utterance.speaker: ARAGON
utterance.content: Are you sure we shouldn’t tell the others?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No. They’ll get nervous and Stone will pick up on it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey, why did you become a cop?

utterance.speaker: ARAGON
utterance.content: Got out of the Army. It’s what made the most sense.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Me too. You miss the service?

utterance.speaker: ARAGON
utterance.content: Some parts. Not others.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Married? Kids?

utterance.speaker: ARAGON
utterance.content: No. Don’t do this, okay? Don’t try to take my mind off of what’s coming. I don’t need anyone holding my hand.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You know, you’ve got a chip on your shoulder the size of Stonehenge. I was just trying to get to know you a little bit.

utterance.speaker: ARAGON
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: See that?

utterance.speaker: ARAGON
utterance.content: Sure did.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The next flicker is go time. You clear on the plan?

utterance.speaker: ARAGON
utterance.content: Don’t worry about me.

utterance.speaker: ARAGON
utterance.content: I can feel vibrations. They’re on the train.

utterance.speaker: JARED
utterance.content: You pull your people back now or everybody dies. Now! I know they’re here. Don’t screw with me, Bob! Or I will pull my hand off this trigger right now!

utterance.speaker: JARED
utterance.content: How am I supposed to trust that they’re gone, hmm? You just tried to send stormtroopers into a subway car full of people, not knowing where they are or where I am …

utterance.speaker: JARED
utterance.content: Wait a second.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Don’t worry. He’s going to be okay.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I know. I know.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How is she?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, at least when she could see Javi she knew he was okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We’ll get Espo back. The key is finding out who Stone was working with.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The answer’s probably in that White Knight directory, but so far tech hasn’t been able to recover any of the data.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well then, we’ll … revisit the victim. Looking into Paul Reeves’ investigations is what led us to Stone. Perhaps it’ll lead us to the others as well.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Tory, let me ask you something. The video from the subway, before it cut out, did you record it?

utterance.speaker: TORY
utterance.content: Of course. All streaming video is archived automatically. Why?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Could you show it to me? There’s something I’d like to see.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: These are all twenty of the case files Paul Reeves was working on. Here’s a summary of those cases. I figured we’d just go through these until something points to Stone or to Erin Wilson or anything else we’re dealing with here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, I’ll start. Uh … the first one is that pharmaceutical lab cited for losing samples of a flu virus.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not ringing any bells. Moving on to a medical chain that knowingly implanted defective artificial hips.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey guys. That document? I think it’s a playbook. Stone’s following it to the letter. Take a look at this sentence fragment.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: “… demand Erin Wilson’s release from prison then hang up.” More instructions? I mean, how is that telling us anything that we don’t already know?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You’ll see. Now take a look at this one.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: “I demand Erin be flown to a non-extradition country.”

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: But that instruction comes later on in the document, which is exactly how Stone played it. First he demanded her release and then he brought up the Maldives.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That doesn’t make any sense. If Stone wanted Erin Wilson freed from prison then why would he wait to mention the Maldives until later?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: For the same reason he asked about Erin Wilson’s release without explaining who she was. Stone is stalling. He’s playing for time. Something else is going on here. Something big.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Kate, I need to show you something.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I noticed something when I was watching earlier, so I went to watch this whole video. We have a problem. A new problem.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: This is Stone back when he was just holding them all hostage. This is him later – – and later.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: His asthma’s getting worse.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: It’s not just his asthma. It looks like he has fever and chills. It’s only a matter of time before he’s not able to think clearly. The man is sick and he’s getting sicker with flu-like symptoms.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Flu-like symptoms? Castle, that case. Paul Reeves was investigating a missing flu virus. This is all connected somehow. It has to be.

utterance.speaker: JARED
utterance.content: Once I hear that she’s in international airspace, I’ll surrender. Because I’m giving you my word.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Stone’s not looking too good.

utterance.speaker: JARED
utterance.content: Hey, exactly how long is that going to take? Huh?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He passes out and releases that switch we’re all dead. We’ve gotta make a move.

utterance.speaker: JARED
utterance.content: Bob, Bob, Bob. That’s not acceptable.

utterance.speaker: ARAGON
utterance.content: Same plan as before?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: ARAGON
utterance.content: When?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He gets distracted when he puffs on his inhaler. Next puff we go.

utterance.speaker: JARED
utterance.content: Look, those are my conditions. Once I hear from Erin that she’s free, I swear I let everybody go.

utterance.speaker: JARED
utterance.content: Don’t worry, everyone. It’s almost over.

utterance.speaker: JARED
utterance.content: Ah! Stop! Please!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Secure the switch.

utterance.speaker: JARED
utterance.content: I’m not done yet. I’m not done yet!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Go, go, go, go.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Good job.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, Javi.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What’s up? We took down Stone. Nobody’s hurt, everybody’s fine. It’s over.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It’s not over, man.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What? What do you mean, it’s not over? I don’t want a ticker tape parade or anything like that, but did you not just hear what I said?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Listen, Javi, this is about more than just a suicide vest. The CDC turned up a lethal variant of the H5N1 virus in Stone’s apartment. It’s a hot zone. Stone’s infected. And everyone around him might be, too.

utterance.speaker: DUSTIN
utterance.content: I got the door open. I got it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Close that door! I said, close it now! Nobody leaves the train!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sir, how is Esposito?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Well, he and the others were transported to the hospital. But they’re in isolation.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What’s the prognosis?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Now, this particular strain of H5N1 is lethal and can be spread through airborne contact. But there is a vaccine. It’s been given to the passengers and it can knock down the virus even after exposure.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So he’s going to be okay?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Doctors are optimistic. And the CDC is retracing Stone’s steps to identify who else he was in contact with.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This guy’s like an evil version of Typhoid Mary. The suicide vest, the demands? All about exposing people long enough to get them infected so they’d spread the virus.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Well, it could have been far worse if he had made it to that seminar or the opera. In proximity to all those people? He could have caused an epidemic. But I’m still not clear. How does our shooting victim fit into all this?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Paul Reeves was investigating the lab where a sample of H5N1 went missing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We think he figured out that Stone had stolen the virus, which is why Stone lured him into the park and killed him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But sir, there are still questions, like who Stone was working with and why he did this in the first place, so we need to go and talk to him.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Well, you better hurry up, because I hear he’s not in good shape.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes, sir.

utterance.speaker: JARED
utterance.content: You’re not the priest.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, but I can take your confession. We know you had help, Mr. Stone.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: White Knight. Who is he?

utterance.speaker: JARED
utterance.content: Someone I met through the Free Erin site a few months back.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What was his real name?

utterance.speaker: JARED
utterance.content: I don’t know. We bonded over Erin. Over how to get her out. He was a strategic thinker and I wasn’t, so he helped me with the plan. I never would have detonated that vest. I just – I just needed some leverage. I love Erin. All I wanted was to see her free.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: More like you wanted to get people sick.

utterance.speaker: JARED
utterance.content: What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You tried to start an epidemic by spreading your deadly virus. Erin was just a sideshow.

utterance.speaker: JARED
utterance.content: What are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The opera, the seminar? Hundreds of one-percenters in close proximity? That was the perfect environment to spread your disease.

utterance.speaker: JARED
utterance.content: It – disease? No, I – I was trying to find the best spot to make my stand for Erin.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then why did you call Paul Reeves?

utterance.speaker: JARED
utterance.content: White Knight just said that it was part of the plan. I – called Reeves to tell him about some meeting at the park. I didn’t even know who he was.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The seminar. And the opera. Where those White Knight’s ideas, too?

utterance.speaker: JARED
utterance.content: So I was set up. Somebody used me. This thing I have – I may have given it to other people, too?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay. That is not how I imagined that conversation would go.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If Stone’s telling the truth, then he’s the fall guy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He was groomed, turned into a vector for the virus, and manipulated into spreading it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which means this all connects to Paul Reeves' investigation of the lab where the virus came from.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Stone was deliberately infected. The CDC confirmed that someone turned his asthma inhaler into a virus delivery system.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Question is, who came up with that idea?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, the answer’s gotta be connected to this lab that Paul was investigating.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I think it is. Beckett, take a look at this. The lab from which the virus went missing, Latham Pharmaceuticals? They’re the same company that makes the vaccine that Espo and the others got.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which is why they had samples of H5N1 in the first place.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right. But as part of his investigation, Paul was looking into production orders of the vaccine, specifically this one for ten million units of the vaccine.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, there were only a thousand reported cases of H5N1 worldwide.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So why would Latham suddenly order up ten million vaccines?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Unless they knew there was going to be an outbreak.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I think Paul was asking the same question.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ms. Jarvis, thank you for taking the time.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, not yet. But we do have a few questions. Now, do you know why he was investigating Latham Pharmaceuticals?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And Latham developed a vaccine for a rare, but deadly flu virus, didn’t they? I mean, a flu so rare that the vaccine just sits on the shelf.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: They do with a little help.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You recently converted all your assets to Latham stock. Why is that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It became my concern when you tried to start an H5N1 epidemic.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: With the help of someone gullible. Someone you could easily manipulate. Like Jared Stone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Your husband was one of the prosecutors who put away his girlfriend, Erin Wilson.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So when you needed a patsy you knew just where to look. And then your colleague, Paul, when he saw that huge vaccine order, he started digging.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And when you saw that he was getting closer to the truth, you eliminated him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Actually, we can. We found the emails you wrote in your cloud account. Under the user name White Knight?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We also arrested a Latham executive with whom you were colluding. He admitted to his role and he cut a deal.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And he threw you under the bus.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You could have infected and killed millions of people, Ms. Jarvis, and for what? So you could drive a nicer car? Buy a bigger house? Was this all just because of money?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You better find a good one.

utterance.speaker: ARAGON
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey. So I uh … I hear everybody’s good to go, clean bills of health.

utterance.speaker: ARAGON
utterance.content: This time yesterday catching the flu was the least of our problems.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You did all right down there. I don’t care what they say about transit cops.

utterance.speaker: ARAGON
utterance.content: Mmm. What they say about gold shields is even worse, mostly because it’s true.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We make a tight team.

utterance.speaker: ARAGON
utterance.content: Bonds forged in the heat of battle. You know how it is.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: ARAGON
utterance.content: I wasn’t straight with you. I have a five year old son.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Uh … you said that you didn’t have a family. Why hide that?

utterance.speaker: ARAGON
utterance.content: I didn’t want you worried about me being a mom down there.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You are a piece of work, Marisa.

utterance.speaker: ARAGON
utterance.content: Who’s Lenny? Or is it Lanie?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: How do you know about her?

utterance.speaker: ARAGON
utterance.content: On my last tour an IED blew out my eardrum. I got pretty good at reading lips. You were saying her name before you took down Stone.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, I don’t … I don’t remember that.

utterance.speaker: ARAGON
utterance.content: Who you think of in that moment? It has weight. Don’t trade what’s real for something that isn’t.

utterance.speaker: ARAGON
utterance.content: I’ll see you around, Javi.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, it’s not every day you come across someone who makes a suicide bomber look like the good guy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So I talked to the hospital. Jared Stone will make a full recovery, though clearly his troubles aren’t over yet.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. Unless he goes to the same prison as Erin Wilson. Because in the end, Jared Stone was driven by the most primal of emotions. Love.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Except he could have picked a better way to express it.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey. Look who’s here.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What’s up?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hail the conquering hero.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Man, you had me scared.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That’s because you’re a wimp.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh. Well, okay.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, well, I guess that makes me a wimp, too.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Got any of that left over for me?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Javi, I was worried sick. I thought that –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I know what you thought. But I’m here. I’m back.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I hate to interrupt, but I have a brilliant idea. How about we all go to the Old Haunt, huh? Drinks on me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Come on. We’ll take the subway.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Too soon?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Too soon.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Please accept this as a token of my apology. Am I on the wrong track here?
